name: Avoid mutable fields inside a class with JCIP @Immutable annotation
description: This rule checks the classes annotated with @Immutable from the Java Concurrency in Practice (JCIP) package. The rule reports any public field without the "final" attribute.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: When annotating a class with @Immutable from JCIP package, one might incorrectly assume that all its fields are immutable.
remediation: Explicitly set the final attribute to the public fields.
alternativeName: Ensure all fields of an @Immutable class have the final attribute
